00020 /// @ingroup semantics
00021 /// a structure of module information
00022 typedef struct _tmodinfo
00023 {
00024   char      name[512]; ///< module name
00025   uint32_t  base;  ///< module base address
00026   uint32_t  size;  ///< module size
00027 }tmodinfo_t;
00028 
00029 typedef struct _old_tmodinfo
00030 {
00031   char name[32];
00032   uint32_t base;
00033   uint32_t size;
00034 }old_modinfo_t;

00053 /// @ingroup semantics
00054 /// locate the module that a given instruction belongs to
00055 /// @param eip virtual address of a given instruction
00056 /// @param cr3 memory space id: physical address of page table
00057 /// @param proc process name (output argument)
00058 /// @return tmodinfo_t structure 
00059 tmodinfo_t * locate_module(uint32_t eip, uint32_t cr3, char proc[]);
00060 
00061 /// @ingroup semantics
00062 /// find process given a memory space id
00063 /// @param cr3 memory space id: physical address of page table
00064 /// @param proc process name (output argument)
00065 /// @param pid  process pid (output argument)
00066 /// @return number of modules in this process 
00067 int find_process(uint32_t cr3, char proc[], uint32_t *pid);

00074 /// is not successful, the return value is set to -1. 
00075 /// This function only works in Windows XP for Now. 
00076 uint32_t get_current_tid();
